metadata.title: Week 2 Day 4: Introduction to Latin Verbs
metadata.faith_phrase: Laborare est orare (To work is to pray)

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should be familiar with basic Latin nouns and their declensions, as well as the concept of subject-verb agreement in English. They have been introduced to the first declension and some basic vocabulary, including common nouns and adjectives. Understanding of Latin sentence structure, particularly the Subject-Object-Verb order, is essential. Students should also recall the vocabulary related to family and school, as well as the concept of noun-adjective agreement.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we explored more complex noun-adjective agreements and practiced translating simple sentences from Latin to English, focusing on the first declension.
misconception_watchlist: Confusing subject and object in sentences

lesson_flow.description: Review noun-adjective agreement and first declension endings.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a quick quiz and discussion.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce basic Latin verb conjugations and subject-verb agreement.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on verb conjugation patterns.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of matching verb endings with subjects.

lesson_flow.description: Practice conjugating verbs with the class using examples on the board.
lesson_flow.student_action: Conjugate verbs in pairs and share with the class.
